column1: Digestive diseases are disorders of the digestive tract, which is sometimes called the gastrointestinal (GI) tract.

The first sign of problems in the digestive tract often includes one or more of the following symptoms: - Bleeding - Bloating - Constipation - Diarrhea - Heartburn - Incontinence - Nausea and vomiting - Pain in the belly - Swallowing problems - Weight gain or loss A digestive disease is any health problem that occurs in the digestive tract.
